page.title: 18A SHOP IN STOURBRIDGE
page.content: {OWEN OWEN The only departmental store in Stourbridge is OWEN OWEN. It was founded by a man caled Owen Owen in Liverpool in 1868. The Stourbridge branch, originally owned by 'Stringers', has a mortuary in the basement and a cinema upstairs, which both are still intact today. In employment at the local branch there are 62 staff and 6000 nationwide.There are 20 lease concessions at the Stourbridge store. The main office in Liverpool is the centre for all the buying that is done. To work in Owen Owen you do not need any specific qualifications. To solve theft they employ store detectives and use close circuit T.V.'s.
